main

Class AntFarm

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.AntFarm

  • public class AntFarm
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates and manages an array of Tiles which are interpreted by the WorldPane and WorldMenuBar classes to create the visible gui.
    Version:
    4/17/2019
    Author:
    Justin, Christian, Jongin, Elijah

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int playspeed
      The time in milliseconds between each WorldPane update.
      private Tile[][] screen
      An array of tiles representing ants and the world environment.
      private static int size
      The size of the length and width of the tile array.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AntFarm()
      Creates a new AntFarm with a 100 x 100 Tile array.

        An array of tiles representing ants and the world environment.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AntFarm

        public AntFarm()
        Creates a new AntFarm with a 100 x 100 Tile array. Rows 1-10 of the array are set to Tile "S" (Soil), the remainder are set to Tile "D" (Dirt). After this, a random assortment of Tiles are set to Tile "F" (Food).

    • Method Detail

      • foodCounter

        public int foodCounter()
        Counts the amount of Food Tiles currently in the Tile Array.
        Returns:
        The number of "F" Tiles

      • workingAntCounter

        public int workingAntCounter(Tile[][] screen)
        Counts the amount of WorkingAnt Tiles currently in the Tile Array.
        Parameters:
        screen - The array to be counted
        Returns:
        The number of "W" Tiles

        public int diggingAntCounter(Tile[][] screen)

        Parameters:
        screen - The array to be counted
        Returns:
        The number of "G" Tiles

      • getScreen

        public Tile[][] getScreen()
        Gets the current Tile Array.
        Returns:
        A 100 x 100 Tile Array

      • setPlayspeed

        public void setPlayspeed(int playspeed)

      • save

        public void save(Tile[][] screen,
                 java.io.File file)
        Saves the current state of the Tile array by writing out letters that each represent a specific Tile type into a text document.
        Parameters:
        screen - The current Tile array
        file - The text document

      • load

        public void load(java.io.File file,
                 Tile[][] screen,
                 Ant[] ants)
        This method updates the current Tile array by interpreting a series of letters from a text document. Once done, it uses the a specified ants location-coordinates to place it in the right position in the Tile array.
        Parameters:
        file - A text document
        screen - The current Tile array
        ants - All of the Ants currently in play
